metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10208 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ext4_fill_super function in fs/ext4/super.c in the Linux kernel through 4.9.8 does not properly validate meta block groups, which allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and system crash) via a crafted ext4 image. Ralf Spenneberg discovered that the ext4 implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate meta block groups. An attacker with physical access could use this to specially craft an ext4 image that causes a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-lowlatency - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-157.207').

linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
